required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Posterior Capsule Opacification (PCO) With AcrySof Single-Piece IOL
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Evaluation of Posterior Capsule Opacification in Myopic Eyes 4 Years After AcrySof Single-Piece IOL Implantation

lead_sponsor.agency: Iladevi Cataract and IOL Research Center

clinical_study.source: Iladevi Cataract and IOL Research Center

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study what to evaluate if axial myopia might influence the development of PCO.

detailed_description.textblock: We sought to prospectively compare PCO in eyes with myopia in relation to axial length with PCO in eyes with normal axial length, to decipher the role of axial myopia in PCO 4 years after surgery for senile cataract.

primary_outcome.measure: the percentage area of PCO with posterior capsule opacity (POCO) software

secondary_outcome.measure: the presence of PCO within the central 3-mm zone were noted

arm_group.description: emmetropic eyes- eyes with an axial length of 21.00 to 23.99 mm

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- local residency and presence of a cataract in an otherwise normal eye.
- Patients older than 50 years
- a dilated pupil after mydriasis
- Patients with retinochoroidal atrophy, retinal laser prophylaxis,
- hypertension
Exclusion Criteria:
- nondilating pupil after maximal dilation;
- pseudoexfoliation; mature, traumatic, black, or complicated cataracts;
- previous intraocular surgery;
- previous surgery for glaucoma;
- uveitis
- diabetes mellitus
- Patients who did not give consent preoperatively

overall_official.affiliation: Iladevi Cataract and IOL Research Center
